Txt_Information_TITLE_JOB_CHANGE.Text: A Change of Vocation: Part I

Txt_Information_TITLE_JOB_CHANGE_RECOMME.Text: A Change of Vocation: Part II
A Change of Vocation: Part III

Txt_Information_TITLE_BREED_MONSTER.Text: Monster Wrangling for Beginners: Part I

Txt_Information_TITLE_BREED_MONSTER_2.Text: Monster Wrangling for Beginners: Part II

Txt_Information_TITLE_WIPEOUT.Text: The Woes of Being Wiped Out

Txt_Information_TITLE_PICK.Text: Sparkly Spots on the World Map

Txt_Information_TEXT_AUTOSAVE.Text: The game will automatically save your progress from time to time<--->like when you enter a town or dungeon. Do not quit the game while the adventure log icon is displayed.

Txt_Information_TEXT_DASH.Text: If you fancy going faster, try holding down <IMG_BUTTON>[Dash] while walking to pick up the pace.

Txt_Information_TEXT_EQUIP.Text: Be sure to equip your belongings instead of leaving them to languish in your bag. You can do this by going to the <6>Equipment<9> section of the main menu.

Txt_Information_TEXT_BAR.Text:
Patty's Party Planning Place in Aliahan is your one-stop shop if you need to recruit some adventurers to join your ranks, or shake up your party.

Your journey is unlikely to be an easy one, so finding a team of trusty travellers at Patty's is a must!

Txt_Information_TEXT_BAR_REPLACE.Text:
If you find yourself wanting to swap out some party members, simply pay Patty a visit at her Party Planning Place in Aliahan.

However, if it's fresh recruits you're after, you'll need to pop upstairs to the Premiere Adventurer Listing Services counter. They'll be more than happy to help you find your ideal ally.

Txt_Information_TEXT_HELP.Text:
Have you noticed the <6>Aid an Adventurer<9> and <6>Ask for Assistance<9> options at Patty's? You can use these features to lend and borrow characters, called <6>volunteers<9>, between adventure logs.

If you fancy learning more, take a look at the <6>Aiding Adventurers<9> and <6>Asking for Assistance<9> Traveller's Tips entries.

Txt_Information_TEXT_HELP_PS5.Text:
Have you noticed the <6>Aid an Adventurer<9> and <6>Ask for Assistance<9> options at Patty's? You can use these features to lend and borrow characters, called <6>volunteers<9>, between adventure logs.

If you fancy learning more, take a look at the <6>Aiding Adventurers<9> and <6>Asking for Assistance<9> Traveller's Tips entries.

Txt_Information_TEXT_HELP_HOST.Text:
You can register party members, excluding the hero, as volunteers at Patty's Party Planning Place. Adventurers on different adventure logs will then be able to add them to their own parties.

However, be aware that volunteers will be stuck with the equipment they had and stay at the level they were when they were registered.

Txt_Information_TEXT_HELP_CLIENT.Text:
If you find you're in need of a bit of extra help, you can add a single volunteer from another adventure log to your party.

Just keep in mind, volunteers are a funny bunch and come with the following quirks:
- They do not level up.
- You cannot change their equipment.

Txt_Information_TEXT_SHOP.Text:
Most towns are home to several shops. Some sell weapons and armour, and some deal in items.

Their wares vary, so make sure to stop by any new shops you see!

Txt_Information_TEXT_CHURCH.Text:
You can record your progress in an adventure log by praying in a church or with nuns. This will allow you to pick up where you left off whenever you resume your journey.

The game does autosave all on its own as well, however these files are overwritten often, so do save manually from time to time. You can create a maximum of nine save files.

Just remember, FASF: fearless adventurers save frequently.

Txt_Information_TEXT_CHURCH_PS5.Text:
You can record your progress in an adventure log by praying in a church or with nuns. This will allow you to pick up where you left off whenever you resume your journey.

The game does autosave all on its own as well, however these files are overwritten often, so do save manually from time to time. You can create a maximum of nine save files.

Just remember, FASF: fearless adventurers save frequently.

Txt_Information_TEXT_INN.Text:
Resting awhile or staying the night at an inn will fully restore your HP and MP. If you find yourself the worse for wear after a bruising battle, head to the nearest inn to relax.

That said, staying at an inn is definitely not a cure for death<--->you'll need to pay a church or a nun a visit if you have someone in need of resurrection.

Txt_Information_TEXT_MAPMENU.Text: If you feel a bit lost, press <IMG_BUTTON>[Map] to take a look at your map. It'll show your current location and give you a good idea of your surroundings too.

Txt_Information_TEXT_DESTINATION.Text:
Not sure where to go next on your adventure? Try turning on the objective marker in the <6>System Settings<9> menu<--->your current objective will then be marked on your map with a golden circle.

Should you need more morsels of information, go ahead and enable quest help text. Then, if you need to know what to do next, simply open the main menu.

Txt_Information_TEXT_MEMORY.Text:
At any time during a conversation, or immediately after it's ended, you can commit what you heard to memory by pressing <IMG_BUTTON>[Memory].

Anything you've chosen to keep in mind can be revisited by selecting <6>Recall<9> in the main menu.

Txt_Information_TEXT_INFORMATION.Text:
<6>Traveller's Tips<9>, a curated collection of useful information, can be found in the <6>Misc.<9> menu. Be sure to give it a look if you need help with controls or aren't quite sure how to get on with your adventure.

More tips will be added as you progress, so make a point of checking for new titbits from time to time.

Txt_Information_TEXT_FULL_RECOVERY.Text:
When you select <6>Heal All<9> from the <6>Misc.<9> menu, your party will use any healing spells at their disposal to completely restore everyone's HP as efficiently as possible.

<6>Handy Heal All<9>, on the other hand, will heal their wounds but without wasting valuable resources on filling up the last few HP, which can be very handy when you don't have many MP to spare.

Txt_Information_TEXT_SHIP.Text:
Set a course for adventure!
Now you've got a ship of your own, it's time to learn how to make the most of it.

If you want to board your boat, walk up to it and press <IMG_BUTTON>[Talk].
If you feel like returning to your land-lubbing ways, sail up to a shore and press <IMG_BUTTON>[Talk].

Txt_Information_TEXT_RAMIA.Text:
The world is truly your oyster now you can soar the skies with Ramia!

If you feel like summoning the Everbird, press <IMG_BUTTON>[Talk].
You can then use <IMG_BUTTON>[Target_Lamia] to choose your precise landing spot,
before tapping <IMG_BUTTON>[Talk] to touch down on the ground.
If you fancy flying a little lower, hold down <IMG_BUTTON>[Dash_Lamia].

Txt_Information_TEXT_JOB_CHANGE.Text:
Other than the hero, any party member who has reached level 20 can change vocations at Alltrades Abbey. Whilst swapping specialities will return a party member to level 1, they'll still remember all their old abilities and spells.

Make a point of trying out as many vocations as you can; learning all kinds of spells and abilities is bound to make you even better at battling!

Txt_Information_TEXT_JOB_CHANGE_RECOMMEN.Text:
Changing vocations will reset a character's level to 1. However, it's not all bad news: their attribute values will only decrease by around half post-vocation change.

In other words, they'll be a bit more beefed up than your average level-1 adventurer pottering around Patty's Party Planning Place.

Changing vocations will reset a character's experience points, but don't fret: they'll level up in no time if you carry them through a few battles.

Their old attribute values will also only be halved post-vocation change, meaning you can make them far mightier than they ever would have been had they stuck with their old vocation.

So, what are you waiting for? It's time to make a change!

Txt_Information_TEXT_TIME_FLOW.Text:
Wandering around the world map, you may notice time ticking away. You'll want to pay attention to this as certain monsters only appear during the day, at dusk or at night-time.

The time of day affects towns too: you might see people getting up to new things, or the town itself may appear entirely differently.

Txt_Information_TEXT_STRATEGY.Text:
Select <6>Tactics<9> from the <6>Misc.<9> menu to change how you and your teammates act in battle.

Party members will act accordingly to whatever tactics you decide to set for them.

That said, if you want a bit more control, selecting <6>Follow Orders<9> will let you tell your allies exactly what to do.

Txt_Information_TEXT_STRATEGY_LIST.Text:
<b>Show No Mercy</>
Use spells and abilities liberally to throw the kitchen sink at enemies.

<b>Fight Wisely</>
Strike a careful balance between offence and defence.

<b>Watch My Back</>
The rest of the party provide backup, allowing the hero to focus on attacking.

<b>Don't Use MP</>
Conserve valuable conjuring power by avoiding all spells and abilities.

<b>Focus on Healing</>
Keep a keen eye on your allies' health and prioritise healing them.

<b>Follow Orders</>
Select specific actions for the party member to take in battle.

Txt_Information_TEXT_PERSONALITY.Text:
The hero and their comrades all have certain personalities. In practice, a party member's personality type will cause some of their attributes to increase faster than others.

Incidentally, if you find you're not a fan of someone's personality, you can actually alter it with certain items and equipment. People really <i>can</> change!

Txt_Information_TEXT_PERSONALITY_STATUS_.Text:
<b>Acrobat</>
Agility increases quickly.

<b>Aristocrat</>
Luck increases extremely quickly; wisdom increases slightly quicker than normal; resilience increases slowly.

<b>Bat out of Hell</>
Agility increases extremely quickly.

<b>Bodybuilder</>
Strength increases extremely quickly; resilience increases slightly quicker than normal.

<b>Charmer</>
Stamina and strength increase quickly.

<b>Clown</>
Agility increases quickly; wisdom and luck increase slightly quicker than normal.

<b>Contrarian</>
Luck increases extremely quickly; agility increases quickly; strength and stamina increase slowly.

<b>Crybaby</>
Luck increases quickly; wisdom increases slightly quicker than normal; resilience increases slowly.

<b>Daredevil</>
Agility and stamina increase quickly; resilience increases slowly.

<b>Daydreamer</>
Agility and wisdom increase slightly quicker than normal.

<b>Drudge</>
Strength increases quickly; resilience and stamina increase slightly quicker than normal.

<b>Egghead</>
Wisdom increases quickly; resilience increases slightly quicker than normal.

<b>Everyman</>
All attributes increase in a balanced fashion.

<b>Free Spirit</>
Resilience and stamina increase slightly quicker than normal; agility increases slowly.

<b>Genius</>
Wisdom increases extremely quickly; agility increases quickly.

<b>Good Egg</>
All attributes increase in a balanced fashion.

<b>Gourmand</>
Resilience increases extremely quickly; strength and stamina increase slightly quicker than normal; wisdom and agility increase slowly.

<b>Happy Camper</>
Luck increases extremely quickly.

<b>Idealist</>
Resilience and strength increase quickly; luck increases slowly.

<b>Ironclad</>
Resilience and stamina increase extremely quickly.

<b>Klutz</>
Agility increases quickly; wisdom and luck increase slowly.

<b>Lazybones</>
Stamina increases quickly; luck increases slightly quicker than normal; resilience and wisdom increase slowly.

<b>Lone Wolf</>
Resilience and stamina increase quickly; luck increases slowly.

<b>Lout</>
Luck increases slightly quicker than normal; wisdom increases slowly.

<b>Lucky Devil</>
Luck increases extremely quickly; agility increases slightly quicker than normal.

<b>Meathead</>
Strength increases extremely quickly; wisdom increases slowly.

<b>Meddler</>
Stamina increases slightly quicker than normal.

<b>Mule</>
Resilience and stamina increase quickly; agility, wisdom and luck increase slowly.

<b>Narcissist</>
Agility increases slightly quicker than normal.

<b>Paper Tiger</>
Stamina increases quickly.

<b>Paragon</>
Strength increases extremely quickly; agility, wisdom and luck increase slowly.

<b>Plugger</>
Resilience and stamina increase quickly; luck increases slowly.

<b>Scatterbrain</>
Agility increases quickly.

<b>Shrinking Violet</>
Stamina increases quickly; wisdom increases slightly quicker than normal; agility increases slowly.

<b>Show-Off</>
Strength, resilience and agility increase slightly quicker than normal.

<b>Slippery Devil</>
Wisdom increases quickly; resilience and agility increase slightly quicker than normal.

<b>Socialite</>
Wisdom and luck increase slightly quicker than normal.

<b>Sore Loser</>
Agility and stamina increase slightly quicker than normal.

<b>Spoilt Brat</>
Luck increases slightly quicker than normal.

<b>Straight Arrow</>
All attributes increase in a balanced fashion.

<b>Tear-Away</>
Strength and agility increase quickly.

<b>Thug</>
Strength increases quickly; resilience increases slightly quicker than normal; wisdom and luck increase slowly.

<b>Tough Cookie</>
Stamina and resilience increase extremely quickly; luck increases slowly.

<b>Wimp</>
Wisdom and luck increase quickly; agility increases slowly.

<b>Wit</>
Wisdom increases extremely quickly.

<b>Vamp</>
Agility and luck increase quickly; other attributes increase in a balanced fashion.

Txt_Information_TEXT_RUN_AWAY.Text:
Feel free to try and flee from battles when the going gets tough; in fact, it can sometimes be your only option when faced with a real piece of work.

However, your escape isn't guaranteed, and the whole party will be unable to act for a turn should they fail to flee. But don't despair: with each failed attempt at fleeing, your odds of actually escaping increase!

Txt_Information_TEXT_CURSE.Text:
Not all equipment is created equal: some pieces of gear will curse you the second you dare don them. Curses can make battles more bothersome and even change your personality.

What's more, once you pop on some cursed gear, you'll be unable to remove it until you get help at a church.

Txt_Information_TEXT_ACCESSORY_PERSONALI.Text:
Some accessories possess the power to change their wearer's personality.

Although, it's worth noting that they only do so when equipped in the main accessory slot. Well, most of the time<--->cursed accessories are a troubling exception to this rule...

Txt_Information_TEXT_MEDAL.Text:
On your adventure, you may come across some shiny trinkets known as mini medals.

These can be traded for all kinds of wonderful prizes with Morgan Minimann, the mini medal enthusiast who dwells in the well in Aliahan.

Txt_Information_TEXT_INVENTORY.Text:
You can store all kinds of objects in your seemingly bottomless bags! That said, you won't be able to rummage through the item or equipment bags while in a fight, no matter how neatly you pack.

In short, if you think you'll need to call on something in a battle, keep it on your person.

Txt_Information_TEXT_SYSTEM.Text: Visit <6>System Settings<9> in the <6>Misc.<9> menu to adjust parameters pertaining to various features.

Txt_Information_TEXT_KEY.Text:
You may have noticed, but there are a fair few doors in the world that are locked shut; as with most doors they can be opened if you happen to have the right key.

The thief's key, for example, can supposedly unlock all red doors in the realm.

Txt_Information_TEXT_RULER.Text:
You can use the Zoom spell or a chimaera wing to return to any towns, castles or dungeons you've been to before.

Now, these methods of transportation will cause you to shoot up into the air, but feel free to use them indoors by all means<--->you'll fly right through any bothersome ceilings that would've ordinarily got in your way. Magic!

Txt_Information_TEXT_STATUS_LIST_1.Text:
<b>HP</> stands for <6>health points<9>. These will be depleted when a character takes damage. Try not to let them all be lost, as this will cause the character in question to collapse.

<b>MP</> stands for <6>magic points<9>. These are required in order to sling spells or unleash abilities.

<b>Attack</> indicates the efficacy of a character's weapon-based blows. This is a combination of the character's own strength and the might of their equipment. The higher it is, the more damage will be dealt by physical attacks.

<b>Defence</> dictates a character's ability to bear the force of physical attacks. This is a combination of the character's resilience and the defensive boost given by their equipment. The higher it is, the less damage will be taken from weapon-based blows.

Txt_Information_TEXT_STATUS_LIST_2.Text:
<b>Strength</> signifies a character's ability to deal physical damage.

<b>Resilience</> reflects a character's basic resistance to physical blows.

<b>Agility</> governs when a character will get their chance to act in battle.

<b>Stamina</> governs how quickly a character's HP increases.

<b>Wisdom</> governs how much damage a character's spells deal. Higher wisdom also allows a character's MP to increase at a faster rate.

<b>Luck</> governs how much damage a character's physical attacks deal. It also influences a character's chances of scoring a critical hit, as well as how likely they are to avoid getting afflicted with status ailments.

Txt_Information_TEXT_WEAK_RESIST.Text:
Some monsters are more susceptible than others to certain spells and abilities.

For example, if you find yourself going up against a frog-like foe, you'll want to focus on using ice.

If an attack is especially effective then the damage dealt will be coloured red. However, if your attack isn't up to par, the damage dealt will be coloured blue.

Txt_Information_TEXT_CHANGE_STATUS.Text:
All kinds of icons can pop up in battle which symbolise temporary changes to your attributes.

Give the <6>Buffs and Debuffs<9> entries a gander if you fancy learning more.

Txt_Information_TEXT_BAD_STATUS_LIST.Text:
<IMG_STATUS>[BAIKIRUTO]: Increased attack.

<IMG_STATUS>[POWER_DOWN]: Decreased attack.

<IMG_STATUS>[DEFENSE_UP]: Increased defence.

<IMG_STATUS>[DEFENSE_DOWN]: Decreased defence.

<IMG_STATUS>[SPEED_UP]: Increased agility.

<IMG_STATUS>[SPEED_DOWN]: Decreased agility.

<IMG_STATUS>[SPELL_ATTACK_UP]: Spells cast on the following turn will do more damage.

<IMG_STATUS>[SPELL_WEAKNESS]: Will take more damage from enemy spells.

Txt_Information_TEXT_BAD_STATUS_LIST_2.Text:
<IMG_STATUS>[MAHOKANTA]: Enemy spells will be reflected.

<IMG_STATUS>[STUN]: Unable to act.

<IMG_STATUS>[BEAST]: Can perform two actions per turn.

<IMG_STATUS>[COUNTER_BREATH]: Will reflect a single breath attack.

<IMG_STATUS>[BUILD_UP_STRENGTH]: Next attack will deal more damage.

<IMG_STATUS>[NO_DAMAGE]: Higher chance of dodging enemy attacks.

<IMG_STATUS>[AUTO_HEAL_MP]: Will recover MP each turn.

Txt_Information_TEXT_BAD_STATUS_LIST_3.Text:
<b>Poison</> <IMG_STATUS>[POISON] does damage to your HP while you walk around the world.

<b>Paralysis</> <IMG_STATUS>[PARALYZE] stops you from acting in battle for a while. Paralysis does not go away immediately after a fight, so be sure to cure anyone afflicted post-battle.

<b>Sleep</> <IMG_STATUS>[SLEEP] causes you to miss your turn. Taking damage sometimes cures the effects of sleep.

Txt_Information_TEXT_BAD_STATUS_LIST_4.Text:
<b>Confusion</> <IMG_STATUS>[CONFUSION] causes you to attack your allies.

<b>Bedazzlement</> <IMG_STATUS>[MANUSA] makes standard attacks more likely to miss. Other attacks, such as spells, are unaffected.

Last but not least, if your <b>spells get sealed away</> <IMG_STATUS>[MAHOTON], you'll find yourself unable to use magic.

Txt_Information_TEXT_POISON_PARALYSE.Text:
Some things are here to stay<--->poison being one of them. Poisoned party members will remain so even post-battle.

Paralysis also persists after battle, but can be cured by going for a stroll once you've finished fighting.

Txt_Information_TEXT_OVERLAP.Text: Certain effects, both beneficial and negative alike, can be enhanced by using the same spell or ability multiple times.

Txt_Information_TEXT_BATTLEROAD.Text:
You'll find monster arenas, where creatures engage each other in friendly fisticuffs, all over the world.

Piles of prizes and gold coins galore are yours for the taking if you can best your fellow competitors!

Should you want anything cleared up, then simply ask the girl by the arena to find out more. You can also learn by doing if you like: why not try your hand at a tournament in Romaria?

Txt_Information_TEXT_BATTLEROAD_BATTLE.Text:
In the arena, your monsters will battle it out in line with whatever tactics you've told them to follow<--->you can't give them any direct commands once a battle's begun.

Feel free to switch things up depending on the situation to show your opponents who's the true monster master!

Txt_Information_TEXT_BREED_MONSTER.Text:
Friendly monsters sometimes decide to settle down in towns and dungeons. These creatures can be rescued, if you can find them.

However, some monsters are a bit jittery, and will scarper if you get too close. Should you come across any critters like this, try using items or abilities that might make you stand out less.

Txt_Information_TEXT_BREED_MONSTER_2.Text:
Monty the Monster Monitor will reward you each time you hit a new milestone for monsters rescued. Try checking in on him from time to time to see if he's got any gifts for you.

It's also worth knowing that the more monsters you send Monty's way, the more abilities your monster wranglers will learn.

Txt_Information_TEXT_PUZZLE.Text:
Edina is home to a puzzling predicament that requires you to move boulders onto three special tiles found on the floor.

But beware: if you accidentally push a rock into the water it will sink...like a stone.

Though, there's no need to lose hope: a simple push of <IMG_BUTTON>[Puzzle_Reset] will move everything back to how it was before you arrived!

Txt_Information_TEXT_WIPEOUT.Text:
Continuing from the last place you saved after wiping out allows you to keep all the experience points and items you had picked up. Sadly, though, you'll lose half of your gold coins in the process. That said, any money you've deposited in the Rainbow's End Bank will be unaffected!

You can also sidestep all of this by continuing from an autosave. This will leave you with the experience points and gold coins that you had when the autosave was made.

Txt_Information_TEXT_PICK.Text: Should you spot any glimmers of light on the world map, be sure to go in for a closer look. You'll be rewarded for your curiosity with items, gold coins and other goodies!

Txt_Information_TEXT_SECRET_AREA.Text:
The world map is full of secret areas just waiting for someone to discover them. These spots often look a little bit different to their surroundings, so keep an eye out for them on your travels.

Stumble upon such a spot and you might find a stash of items or gold coins. If you're lucky, you might find something altogether more special than either of those!

Txt_Information_TEXT_CLEAR.Text:
You can now pay the heavens a visit! If you want to reach the realm above, make your way to the Castle of the Dragon Queen.

Word has it there's a mighty being up there with the power to grant all kinds of wishes.

But be warned: the monsters up in the clouds pack an even mightier punch than those down below, so make sure you're prepared for what awaits before setting off.

Txt_Information_TEXT_GAMEMODE.Text:
Pay a visit to the <6>Difficulty Settings<9> part of the <6>System Settings<9> menu at any time during your adventure if you fancy adjusting the game's difficulty. You'll have three options to choose from:

<b>Dracky Quest</>
Your party will never be wiped out, no matter how much damage you take.
You will deal more damage to enemies.
Some bosses will no longer automatically heal themselves at the start of their turns.

<b>Dragon Quest</>
Experience the game on the recommended difficulty setting.

<b>Draconian Quest</>
All bosses will have more HP.
Enemies will deal more damage.
You will deal less damage when exploiting enemies' weaknesses.
You will earn fewer experience points and gold coins from battles (the experience points and gold coins on the <6>Defeated Monster List<9> are only accurate for the Dracky and Dragon Quest difficulties.)

Txt_Information_TEXT_FIELDMENU.Text: Opening the main menu's easy: just give <IMG_BUTTON>[FieldMenu] a press!
